Reading / Language Arts Complete pages 14-15 in the grammar workshop book (due in the next LA class) We will act out the Hare and the Tortoise Next week on FRIDAY (29th) in the Piazza. Please remember your lines and discuss with your partner how you want to act out the role play. üìù Weekend Personal Narrative Assignment This weekend, you will write a personal narrative in your journal notebook. A personal narrative is a story about something that happened to you, or something you are going to do. You will tell it in your own words and include your feelings, thoughts, and experiences. Steps to Complete Your Personal Narrative Plan in your My View book. Think about what you want to write about and pick one small event from your weekend. Add details. Write what you saw, heard, smelled, tasted, and felt. Use order words like First, Then, Next, After that, Finally to help your story flow. Show your feelings. Were you happy, nervous, excited, or scared? Write your story in your journal notebook. Make sure it has a beginning, middle, and end. ‚úèÔ∏è Example Personal Narrative My Weekend Plans My Weekend This weekend was a little scary and very fun. On Saturday morning, I went to the dentist to get a dental implant. I felt a little nervous because it was my first time having an implant. First, the dentist checked my teeth and prepared my mouth. Then, they carefully put in the implant. It didn‚Äôt hurt too much, and I knew it would make my tooth strong and healthy. After it was done, I went home and rested. On Sunday, I took my three kids to a kids' caf√©. I was excited because I knew they would have so much fun. First, we ordered drinks and snacks. Then, my kids played in the ball pit, climbed on the slides, and tried the toys. I watched them and helped when they needed it. After that, we ate some cake and ice cream together. Finally, we went home feeling happy and tired from all the fun. I enjoyed my weekend. Saturday was a little scary, but Sunday was full of laughter and fun with my kids. ‚úÖ Quick Checklist Make sure you picked one small event from your weekend. Write what happens first, next, and last. Include your feelings and thoughts. Add details about what you saw, heard, smelled, tasted, or felt. Check that your story has a beginning, middle, and end.
